intro: Chisocheton siamensis, commonly known as the Siam chisocheton, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. It produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
